name: Kraven Manor
description: Turn out the lights, take a deep breath, and prepare yourself. Explore the depths of the immersive, atmospheric world of Kraven Manor. Uncover its secrets, solve its mystical puzzles, and face its growing threat. Face your fears and see if you have what it takes...the doors of Kraven Manor await you.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP SP2, Windows Vista, or Windows 7 Processor: 2.0 GHz Single Core Processor, 1 Thread Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA 6200 / ATI Radeon 9600 DirectX: Version 9.0c
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows Vista SP2 or Windows 7 Processor: 2.4+ GHz Dual Core Processor, 2+ Threads Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA 7800 GTX+ / ATI x1300+ DirectX: Version 9.0c

reviews.review_text: Now, this is one game almost solely dedicated to the notion of SPOOKY. The other recurring theme is MODELS: No, not the wafer-thin things which caper about on cat-walks, but rather a three-dimensional model of the title building and its attendant rooms/sections (an absolutely ingenious device which you'll just have to play the game to 'spoil' for yourself), as well as some of the hands-down scariest bronze statues/art models you will ever have the good fortune to be terrorized by.    I gotta say, it's always nice to be so pleasantly surprised by a game you didn't even know existed until it was already available in the Steam store (the last such game for yours truly was perhaps Outlast, so this title is in mighty good company therein). This isn't to say there aren't a few problems, however...   Firstly, the Steam asking price is a tad silly for a game which even I managed to complete in under two hours ('cause believe me, I play games kinda sloooooow). The project is apparently the product of university students graduating from a game design course, so within those parameters it's impressive as hell, but it doesn't hurt to recognise that even the very best of such projects can't exactly go head-to-head with the 'big boys', especially price-wise.    Secondly, there's a fair few glitches...on more than one occasion, I had a particular enemy permanently freeze on me; which might almost sound like a 'good'/opportunistic thing, but decidedly less so when you require said enemy to cause damage to something in order for you to progress.    Also, I had a hell of a time getting a couple of objects to successfully interact with what they were SUPPOSED to interact with. I especially had no end of fun trying to get a round ornamental medal thing to go into its appropriate slot in a wall...thought I must be missing something...looked up a video walkthrough and lo and behold, the dude playing it gets it in first go without even trying. One game reboot later and I finally managed it, but again not quite as promptly as Mr Walkthrough did, so...yes, problems, it had a few. I did however break with my usual cheapskate tradition (of waiting for a decent sale) and bought this game smack-dab on its release date, so perhaps these little bugs will be corrected with time...   On the whole, though...VERY impressed. Expect big, big things from the people involved. For now, this one merely qualifies as just a single 'big', but there's no doubt there's some talent involved here. If I were their teacher, I would definitely give them an 'A' (but not quite an 'A+')...but since I'm not a teacher, I'll simply rate them in my standard manor (whoops, make that 'manner'), and round off my review with the customary:  Verdict: 8.5/10.

great game i recommend this game strongly the game is beautiful and the game keeps you sucked in but though i strongly recommend this game just wait until it goes on sale i bought this not knowing the game was this short and beat it within 2hrs 9.99 is a bit steep for a 2hr game and once you beat it you could probably get through in under an hour so wait til the price drops a bit over all score for me 7/10 great game near perfect exacution but price compared to length is what will hurt this game

This is an indie gem and please do not get repulsed by a mixed vox populi.   Firstly, this game is super short. I have finished my first playthrough in about 1.5 h taking my time to read all notes and paying attention to details. My second playthrough in which I aimed to get to the alternative ending took me about.. 27 minutes... the plot is simple but engaging, there are scary moments, but enough to remain scary, not frustratingly repetitive. The atmosphere of the old manor is felt and the graphics are surprisingly good conidering this is an indie title made by students (as far as I know).   However what makes this game unique is the concept of dynamically creating the environment around you, which certainly should be developed into future, more complex project.   Consider this game as an indie with a lot of potential to become a successful aaa if developed with proper amount of money and resources.   This game if deffo worth getting on sale r in the bundle. You will not be disappointed.   Also, I would recommend to all Cube (the movie) fans.. for a valid reason :)  7/10 = a solid short indie title, with nice concept and neat graphics

I went into this game and decided to start out on nightmare difficulty. Let me just say that the name is dead on. That flashlight dies at the worst possible times. Great short game with multiple endings, although it can get pretty confusing at times as there is not alot of assistance with the direction certain puzzles want you to go.
If you are a fan of horror games, definately try out this game. It's a very original and short game that will scare you until you reach the end.
decided to be a badass and play on hard mode-- rip pants 2015
10 minutes in and im already crapping myself, very good game so far 10/10

I have to say one thing about this game, which is that the graphics are absolutely gorgeous. The details on every inch of the game you encounter looks amazing and sets the perfect mood for the game; cozy, yet spooky. Also, the concept of being able to move different modules of the manor around is quite unique and interesting.  However, you don't get a lot of context as to what you're doing in the Kraven Manor apart from reading notes, which nobody really does. At some parts I even got a little bit stuck because of some unclear guidance, where the enemy kept touching me in inappropriate places. I think they could've done a little bit more work on that.  Another thing is that you need to properly WANT to survive in order to feel terrified by the enemy, which usually isn't the case with horror games that have monsters with some impressive artificial senses and intelligence. This means it's as scary as you want it to be, instead of forcing it upon the player.  All in all, I do enjoy playing this game and I would recommend it to anyone interested in horror games. If you need a little bit more context about this game, I would suggest watching my playthrough. You'd get a pretty good impression on what it's all about:         YouTube™ Video:  DAT ♥♥♥ - Kraven Manor part 1

If you like horror games, I recommend.  I do not like horror games and I am completely a wuss when it comes to this sort of game. That said, the atmosphere was SO GOOD that I couldn't play more than a few minutes.  I got the first room, plopped it down, and couldn't figure out how to get into it by the time the tension had mounted too high for me to be able to keep playing. SUCH atmosphere. SO scary. Wow.  I have no idea how this game has such low ratings unless these people just don't like being scared because this game is SO scary! And a cool idea! I wish I had the guts to play it. *shudder*
This is an interesting game from a certain point of view. I enjoyed playing it, does have a special graphic and great game mechanics, the overall sound is good. Keeps you entertained and satisfied.

This game is wonderful! I am so glad they finally brought it out for a full release! The changing rooms around is an awesome creative addition to horror! Mannequins are terrifying and they put the animations of the main evil to great use! I can't wait to play more of this! If you want to see some Gameplay of this game but don't want to play it yourself or maybe you prefer to see the beginning to decide, check it out on my channel! These guys needs so much more exposure they will go on to do GREAT work!          YouTube™ Video:  Kraven Manor | IT'S FINALLY OUT! | Part 1
Really good game but also extremely short. Only took me and some friends an hour to beat it.

Overview: First Person Survivor Horror   If you can get the game for a couple of dollars it would be worth it. Its extremely short at roughly 1 hour game time. It offers some light puzzle solving, story and some scares. The fact that it was made by students doesn’t feel fair to compare it to other major studios efforts. A quick time waster and nothing more.

The scariest thing in this game is bad optimization.
The scariest thing in this game is bad optimization.

Had alot of peotential but was very restrained. The art direction was superb and as well the ambiance. I agree with other reviewers that the game was really short... It was not worth that amount of cash... 5 bucks is a fair price to purchase this at.

The dummy moves at an incredible pace if you don't look at it, or if you are surrounded by darkness and you're not using your flashlight. Unfortunately it keeps teleporting itself too, which is pretty cheap and way too 'random' to wonder if you're not wasting your time try to avoid it while trying to finish the game at hard.

Despite being game from my wishlist... Despite having good looks... Despite getting it for free... Despite game's original idea with house 'management'.  I don't recommend this game due to some mechanics I don't really like.
